    • Method Detail

      • shouldVisit

        public boolean shouldVisit(Page referringPage,
                           WebURL url)
        This method receives two parameters. The first parameter is the page in which we have discovered this new url and the second parameter is the new url. You should implement this function to specify whether the given url should be crawled or not (based on your crawling logic). In this example, we are instructing the crawler to ignore urls that have css, js, git, ... extensions and to only accept urls that start with "http://www.ics.uci.edu/". In this case, we didn't need the referringPage parameter to make the decision.
        Overrides:
        shouldVisit in class WebCrawler
        Parameters:
        referringPage - The Page in which this url was found.
        url - the url which we are interested to know whether it should be included in the crawl or not.
        Returns:
        if the url should be included in the crawl it returns true, otherwise false is returned.

      • visit

        public void visit(Page page)
        This function is called when a page is fetched and ready to be processed by your program.
        Overrides:
        visit in class WebCrawler
        Parameters:
        page - the page object that is just fetched and parsed.
